website_summaries.verdict: Boasting a touch-screen display, an app store, and ePrint (a remote printing service), the HP Envy 100 features loads of innovation in a slickly designed chassis. We wouldn't buy this printer for its image quality, but the convenience of ePrint and the potential of the ePrintCenter app store earn the HP Envy 100 our recommendation.
pros: New ePrint feature enables wireless printing by e-mail
Web-based ePrintCenter offers expanded functionality via downloadable apps
ePrintCenter with free app store offers versatile functionality
enclosed cartridge bay for quiet printing
cons: two-ink-cartridge bay produces mediocre photo quality
low-volume paper input tray can only hold 80 sheets at a time

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Buggy Beyond Belief
customer_reviews.text: Steer clear of this printer. If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. I have a Cisco Valet router and nothing but problems with this printer. My devices don't recognize it unless I reset my router and the printer every time I want to print. The apps on the printer yield constant errors and will not work. I've tried all sorts of updates to both the printer and router, manual configuration of IP addresses, and nothing solves the problem. If you do a google search, you'll notice many people experiencing the same problems. I paid close to $200 and really I just want to throw the thing in the dumpster. It's so frustrating and inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: jerseyJD

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the same printer which had gone bad. Paid $100 used.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sackett

customer_reviews.title: I hate to say it, I always buy hp, this unit caused me all sorts of issues
customer_reviews.text: I tried using multiple hosts and everything else I could the of, now here is the part where I tell you guys what my skills are so no one will think that I must be dumb because I could not setup a printer.....I have been working on computers for 4 days, well make that five since it's past midnight in my time zone.....I eventually donated this guy to the Salvation Army, I always shoot my gear to the Salvation Army assume its something they want.....
customer_reviews.author: M Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to worth it.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer for the simple fact that it worked for printing via wi-fi for an IPAD. It printed fine. Quality was good but the very first time we attempted to scan an image with the built in scanner it failed to work. The mechanism moves but it only prints a black screen. Read some troubleshooting tips online and discovered that MANY people were having the same issue and that HP wasn't going to do anything about it. Stay away, not worth much at all.
customer_reviews.author: shivels

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: The product is perfect for light home office use. It installed in two minutes and works perfectly with my Apple desk top and two I Pads. There is no set up on the I Pads. Plug the printer in, let it find your network, type in your password and you are ready to go. I picked up my I Pad hit print and a beautiful double sided print came out. I was blown away. I am not technologically great and set up usually involves a painful couple of hours for me. I did set the update function to manual after reading about all the update problems. Very cool product!
customer_reviews.author: J21958

customer_reviews.title: Love this cool printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the HP Envy 100 e all in one to use for work from my laptop (Windows7) and also from my iPAD via airprint and it has worked flawlessly so far (one month of use) for both. Setup was easy - just had to enter the passphrase for the router. It is not fast when printing colour, but then I didn't expect it to be. The colour is good and the black is crisp. It is a cool looking printer and doesn't take up a lot of space in my office.
customer_reviews.author: kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Poor support
customer_reviews.text: I've had trouble with the Envy from the very beginning. I kept receiving 'error' messages while installing the Envy. I was finally able to resolve this problem, no thanks to HP's support system. The problems that I am incurring now are: 1. the print door does not always shut after printing. 2. several times it does not print at all and I have to reboot the printer. I have had HP printers in the past and have been very satisfied, but I would definitely not recommend the HP Envy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: super easy to set up. prints both sides of paper, which was HUGE for me to save paper. My old HP printer i'd have to re-feed the paper if i wanted to print on both sides, which was super annoying and inconvienent. print quality is pretty good, i have no complaints. we use this from desktop computers (windows based) and from iphone/ipad. Would highly recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Good but not all it's cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive what I was lead to believe was an extremely quiet printer. Well, it's not. True that it is very sleek and good looking, but it makes the same noises that any printer makes. The Internet feature is nice on the small screen, but kind of hokey. I can still just go to a weather website, for example and print the seven day forecast. I don't need to look at and scroll through little icons on the printer's little screen. All in all I like it because it is sleek and compact, but in the end, it's just a printer for heavens sake.
customer_reviews.author: The Frenchman

customer_reviews.title: HP Envoy100
customer_reviews.text: Arrived well packaged. Set up wireless connection in 10 minutes. The best printer for the money, period. Superior results in both color and black & white. So far the best printer I have owned since I got into computers in 1983. Yes it's a shame multi-pages fall to the floor but I simply let em fall. Not a big deal considering all the features packed into this small compact unit. % stars from this happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Wm Posey

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had a good printer for years which finally broke down. Since I now have an ipad, I decided to look into an HP wireless that I could use with that. This printer was a great price from ALLPRICESGOOD and since I already did some research on it, I decided to go with this model. It was the best decision. The printer is quiet, prints fine, and scans better than my Canon did. It looks great since it is so beautifully slim-lined. It is very easy to set up and the photos and cards turn out excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Meli

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy 100 Review
customer_reviews.text: I bought the HP envy 100 printer primarily so I could print from my iPad2. This it does flawlessly. What I did not expect was how handy the scanner and copier function would be. I am a little disappointed in the print quality especially when I do a side by side comparison with my HP laser printer. Some have criticized the slow print speed. While I concur that print speed is slow it is not an issue with me because I am not in a hurry since I am retired!
customer_reviews.author: Al Gorithm

customer_reviews.title: Very bad product. The display stop workin after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Very bad product. The display stop workin after 2 months, and rh scanner after 3 month. I bought 2 item
customer_reviews.author: Jose gabriel lugo

customer_reviews.title: Screen on the printer went black = dead printer = no HP support
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product I cant believe we just use it 5 or 6 times, when turned on the screen on the printer went blank and there is no workaround to fix it. Try every troubleshooting step and enden in a support call from HP telling me to buy a new one at a disscounted price because they dont know what to do with this screen issue. Look on forums and this problem is well documented and has no fix. You need to update or connect to a wireless network but it is impossible since the printer screen is not working.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: This printer is just OK. I have to replace the ink way too much, which gets very expensive. It also shuts down for no reason a lot. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: J Alexander

customer_reviews.title: HP you can do better.
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say lgi_electronics was very kind in letting me return this item - thanks bunches. Printer was very poorly made extending arm didn't always want to work and for whatever reason stopped printing often. Would not recommend purchasing this product, actually surprised HP has never given me problems before.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Lady

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the biggest hunk of garbage. The thing never worked over my wireless network properly. It will just randomly start printing hundreds of pages of symbols, or print symbols or text on the opposite side of whatever I am trying to print. Sometimes it won't print at all. Turn it off and on again and it works, then it prints a hundred pages of symbols again. Makes "streaks" like the heads need to be cleaned. You clean and test the heads and the test page looks great. Then print a document and the problem is still there. If Amazon allowed zero stars I would give the product that rating. SAVE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: MSPE

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built, piece of garbage with pretty name
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen quit working within a year. Although HP said they were aware of the problem and would fix it with a firmware update they never did. Only holds about 1/4 of a ream of paper. No auto feeder, and basically a poorly designed All-In-One that isn't. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Harbick

customer_reviews.title: Desirable machine
customer_reviews.text: The machine is a great combination of looks/style, ease of setup and use, and adequate document quality. The scanner is fine, too. This does not mean that the output is perfect. It's not. Photos are good enough, but not excellent. Print quality is very good, but not laser. But it is just so convenient, and is acceptable on the kitchen counter as a plus, rather than a minus, that I recommend it for all general printing at home, or if you want a stylish printer in the office. Almost forgot to mention that being wireless, and Mac-compatible is what I bought it for, and it exceeded my expectations. The wife LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: jfriar2

customer_reviews.title: Pricy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived defective. Cartridges would not align. Took to a local ITT. Remains defective
customer_reviews.author: mssunshine

customer_reviews.title: If the thing worked I'd love it
customer_reviews.text: This printer is by far the worst and most labor intensive printers I've come across. Numerous calls to HP customer support to fix the connectivity issues have not solve the problem. If I want to print I have to either shut down my computer, wifi, or the printer before it will work. When it does finally start printing it constantly jams. I would not recommend this printer if my life depended on it. The wireless print is cool, but not at the expense of all this trouble. I want to go Office Space on this thing right now!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Redmer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: I had to do a lot of research at HP's site to get my printer to find my network. Finally got it and everything was cool. That is until I went to print again about 3 weeks later and once again the printer can't find the network. Haven't had the time to research the issue yet. Very poor documentation. I like the features and the output.
customer_reviews.author: Paul U.

customer_reviews.title: Died right after warranty expired!!!
customer_reviews.text: slick little printer...alittle slow and was never able to get the photo's to print out sharp? Now it's completely died and is out of warranty..of course. So I spent 250 dollars for 1 year of scanning and printing. Sad thing is I bought one for the house and one for the office...lets see when the other one decides to die. I'd say go with a canon..never buying HP again
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shorten

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for medium to light printing jobs
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer, easy set up for air-print and e-print. It is not fast if you need a "production" printer, but does a great clear, crisp print job. Sleek design and easy to follow instructions on the printer display. Also does a good job on photos.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Meets the need for home office
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a wireless printer to replace my old HP Deskjet in my home office. Some of the recent models look cheap and bulky and are criticized for being noisy. The HP Envy 100 meets the need. The setup went so smoothly and the scan and copy features were easy to learn. It's compact and attractive on the desk. The only drawback is the lack of separate feeder for envelopes. You need to remove the paper from the paper tray in order to insert envelopes. This is not a frequent occurrence for me so it is easy to overlook.
customer_reviews.author: eastwest

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a timely manner, but did not work. I have had an incredible amount of problems getting response from seller and Amazon. HP finally replaced the printer. I would rather not have this model, but was locked in to it because of only being allowed to get a replacement. After I discovered they would do that because of the warranty, I finally got a reply from seller.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Cappone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: Super price and well worth it. The HP Envy 410a is AirPrint enabled, and integrated immediately and fully into my home network (PC-Linux-Mac) with no problems at all. Prints great quality, duplex without having to mess with anything. Prints pictures down to 4x6 with no problems; lovely colors. Drivers easily obtained. Absolutely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Envy 100
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, easy wireless setup with a mac and also windows pc. I've had other HP printers and many are horrible piles of junk. this model is one of their best I've ever had, and I've owned at least 12.
customer_reviews.author: amr

customer_reviews.title: Always trying to update itself- but never succeeds
customer_reviews.text: This never did work as promised. The printer was always trying to update itself- but never succeeded. It looks good but does not perform well. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: USED advertised as NEW
customer_reviews.text: ADVERTISED on the Website as NEW, found out the serial number shows it was purchased in 2011 by someone else. Terrible printer,doesn't work, jams constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great home office printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for the home or home office. It was easy to set up on my existing home WiFi network. The software runs smoothly on my Win7 PC and my Android devices. Print quality is very good. It looks great!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: A dream come true.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased an iPad2 to replace a really crummy laptop. I was hoping to live computer-free for a bit but was hesitant to believe it was possible. The hp envy was the perfect solution for me. Within ten minutes of opening the box (an act that was also surprisingly user-friendly), I was all set up and able to print wirelessly from my iPad. (Ok, I didn't time it!) The printer feels very slick when it does things like raising and closing the screen automatically (when powered on and off.) I have not put it through the paces but so far, I am in love.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Envy
customer_reviews.text: I never knew a printer could be so cool. It is sleek and attractive. The setup was so easy I just could not believe I was finished. couple of steps out of the box and follow directions on the CD. I was able to connect the laptop and IPad with ease. My reason for buying was the IPad only works with wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Noble

customer_reviews.title: Wow that was easy.
customer_reviews.text: Finally replaced my aging HP printer this week with the Envy. Set up couldn't have been easier. All iPads and iPods immediately found the printer. Set up all 4 PCs with in minutes too. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Smithone

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but also looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I have a wireless system in my home, and mostly use an iPad to surf and email. With this wireless printer, I don't have to email things to my home computer and then print it out...(think boarding passes) and the scan feature elminates the need for a fax machine... The printer also prints double sided with out having to re-load the paper. this saves paper !! At this low cost, you really need to upgrade to this beautiful printer.. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I've setup a lot of printers over the years but this has to be one of the easiest, especially wireless. The ePrint technology works as advertised, as I have an iPhone 4 and iPad and printing from ios could not be easier. The only drawback is the small paper tray, if you plan on doing heavy print jobs you'll be refilling the paper tray a lot. The color quality is good and extremely fast in draft mode. I'm happy and glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Network Printing
customer_reviews.text: This device is ideal for printing if you own an iPad. You also have a e-mail address excellent for communication, Smartphone or ipod, it works with Laptop and desktops.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fair
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't hold enough paper, very complicated. A primadonna of printers
customer_reviews.author: Bopvb

customer_reviews.title: Problems
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer about 5 months ago and do not use it very often. One minute it was fine, the next second the papper was getting jammed, over and over. Even if there is no paper jam, the screen reads that there is and you have to keep re-setting it. Customer phone support was helpful but did not resolve the issue. I would stay away from this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jones

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy 100
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer used against my better judgment. I should have listened to the voice in my head. These printers have a history of breaking down and losing the copy and scan functions. That is the way this one came to me. It still prints, which is the main reason I bought it, but a seller who would offer a product in this condition is not to be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: J Scott Randles

customer_reviews.title: Bulb died
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months and about 20 uses the bulb for scanning and copying died. That makes my all in one just a printer. Too bad I really need the scanning more than the printing. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Hall

customer_reviews.title: decent printer
customer_reviews.text: I needed to buy an airprint and settled on this one. I only gave it four stars because I found it does not like 20lb paper. It ate it up and wouldn't print. I ended up having to buy 24lb stock for everyday printing.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the slickest printer I have owned. The space it takes up relative to what it can do is amazing. Works easily printing from my iPad or iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Easiest install ever
customer_reviews.text: I rarely spend time to write reviews..but got this HP envy wireless printer specifically for wireless capability (for printing from iPAD)..and had it installed in 15 minutes from box to working..love the set-up..and on top of the ease of install, it is a very compact cool device...
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Scanner does not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a christmas gift, however the printer part works good but everything you scan just appears up with a bunch of lines through it.
customer_reviews.author: Approach!

customer_reviews.title: As Easy as 1-2-3 up and running in no time
customer_reviews.text: A great solution and easy Wi-Fi set up , I plugged in and was ablt to set up from Apple MBP, iPad 1 & 2 no problem ( using Air Port ) also installed simple drivers for Windows XP/Win 7 laptops and all worked perfectly. Using copy function just as easy, and scanner! Print quality is good for basic color printing have not used for photos yet. But so far so good! Also looks great on our AV rack with TV/BlueRay etc..
customer_reviews.author: LMC

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the price. Easy to setup. If you have a mac, don't even bother using the CD install disc. Just add printer through preferences, and all the drivers will be updated automatically. Works great with my iPhone and iPad. Love the e print capability too where you can send to an eprint email that you get when you set it up. Can send documents from anywhere to that email address and it will print on the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Jansen

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE BEST PRINTER I HAVE EVER HAD AND I OWNED SEVERAL BUSINESSES
customer_reviews.text: I AM A RETIRED BUSINESS OWNER... HAVING OWNED A VOCATIONAL COLLEGE... WELLNESS CLINICS AND A LARGE BOARDING/BREEDING KENNEL FOR DOGS AND HORSES... THIS LITTLE PRINTER IS COMPACT AND A WORK-HORSE AND IS RELIABLE! I LOVE IT... I HAVE NEVER SAID THAT BEFORE ABOUT ANY PRINTER! WE DID OUR GETTING TO KNOW EACH OTHER DANCE INITIALLY... EVERYTHING HAS ITS QUIRKS INCLUDING US... BUT NOW I KNOW IT AND IT IS GREAT!!! BINGO!!!
customer_reviews.author: TruthSayer

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I usually stay away from first generation products and let the bugs get worked out but now after almost 2 years I'm still very happy with the quality of this wireless printer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Williams

customer_reviews.title: An amazing all-in-one machine
customer_reviews.text: It is a good machine overall. I particularly like it's network features. The display and the menu's are as comprehensive as the menu's of computers. It is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Printer
customer_reviews.text: When I did a google search for a printer that had all of the attributes I needed in a printer, this was the only one that came up repeatedly. Amazon had it at a great price. I got it and I couldn't be happier. Perfect Printer.
customer_reviews.author: KlbgWilliams

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy
customer_reviews.text: HP set the bar when they designed this device. Not only is it stylish its packed with features. We have several idevices in our home and we can now print from those devices direct to the printer. If you have kids there are several web app to choose from to print crafts and coloring pages direct from the printer. The HP Envy is right at home in your family room
customer_reviews.author: Jovaughn N Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave it a five star but it started jamming a lot a year in and shut down within a year and a half of purchase. It is beautiful and initially works great, but then the problems start with jamming, and with not printing at all.... I tried all of the online fixes I could find on youtube.... nothing worked. Too bad it was out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Plano Gal

customer_reviews.title: small paper tray
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully with my iPad and iPhone. I wish it held more paper. It was very easy to setup and use wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hood

customer_reviews.title: HP dropped support for their apps which was the whole ...
customer_reviews.text: HP dropped support for their apps which was the whole point of this printer. Touchscreen display partially failed after 3 years but it still responds to taps.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Colleton

customer_reviews.title: Intelligent, easy to use, and wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer for college. It is wonderful! The design is extremely compact, especially for an all-in-one printer. The wireless printing makes the desk less cluttered. The quality of both the product and the quality of the printed material are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: TeenHeart

customer_reviews.title: Hp envy 100
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer, Have had no problems so far. Set up is a cinch. If you have wireless, it's about as easy as it gets. One thing to remember, The disc that comes with it Software) is usually outdated, So just go online to hp site and there is a download prompt for the current software, easy as pie.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Kantas

customer_reviews.title: Sleek & Pretty
customer_reviews.text: As the title says it is sleek & pretty. I really love the way it looks & seems to work well. I haven't done a lot of printing on it yet but so far great. It was easy to set up om my own too. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: weekettle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cost Benefit
customer_reviews.text: The equipment is outstanding, very friendly using and works great with Mac AirPrint. You can print photos in a very good quality directly from your iPhone, iPad, iMac. Very well served by Amazon and HP has reached a good level of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jack Ktisti

customer_reviews.title: Simply, I needed a NO hassle printer for 2 IPAD 2's and iPhone 4
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of dealing with tempermental Printer Apps in the app store, have concluded they are crap, ----finally had enough ---deleted all app store printer apps and ordered the envy. I set it up in 5 minutes and printed from both iPads and the iPhone....simple directions and no tech crap!!! ---End of story.... With Amazon's no hassle replacement and/or return policy there is no risk. Those negative reviews on the Envy are crap and because of them I stayed away from the envy for a number of months....my loss.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Really like this printer, easy to set up and use, especially for someone who is not a real pro at this kind of thing. I like that it doesn't have to be connected to computer tower. So far, been pleased with my purchase. Nothing specific to add, because I am not a technical guru.
customer_reviews.author: rglaird

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup and fast printing. Super quiet and it works with all my wireless devices, including my iPad. Looks great and super compact. It seems to be going through ink pretty quick but all printer do. Eprint and the apps are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Milstead

customer_reviews.title: Not completely easy to connect with ALL devices
customer_reviews.text: We typically end up emailing a PDF document to the printer's custom email address in order to complete important print jobs. Great quality prints though
customer_reviews.author: Leelee

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with the newer I Mac. Could not update the driver on HP. If I gphad an older computer, I would of kept it. Very sleek looking
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Displeased !!!
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for about a week when it went into an endless reboot cycle. I would usually have just returned to Amazon but I threw away the packing material when it worked after a few days. I bought this to print with my iPad and iPhone since HP is the only native option currently. I spent 2 hours on the phone with technical support and they are sending me a replacement. Unfortunately I didn't asked whether it would be a refurb or a new machine. Apparently another reviewer was offered a refurb. If it is a refurb This will be the last HP product I purchase. My advise don't buy this printer!!
customer_reviews.author: FrankG

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iphone/ipad
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a printer that worked easily with my iphone and ipad. This has been the answer! Works flawlessly. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: KeithM

customer_reviews.title: Function failure
customer_reviews.text: Function visual display window went out in less than a year and I have to operate everything from the desktop program.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Strutt

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Sexy
customer_reviews.text: Its sexy and simple to use. Looks like a Blu Ray player beneath my TV stand. I can print from IPAD, IPHONE, my laptop or just send an email and it prints when I'm not at home. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Legington

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Slick design, works very well with my Macs. One glitch in the startup was probably operator error, but I rebooted the device with the computer on and all was well. Used as a wireless device, it was easy to set up for my networked computers.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Croucher

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: i love it and i love it very hightech for its price and i like or the different features it has to offer
customer_reviews.author: alice

customer_reviews.title: Love this sleek machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this stealth little machine. It does so much in such a sleek package. The scanner is incredible and haven't had a problem with the printer yet. Love to be able to print from anywhere in the house & setup was easy.
customer_reviews.author: GJD

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great and fills the bill for my needs for daily use. Very pleased with quality and efficiency for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great network printer. The installation was easy and the wireless printing works flawlessly! Hewlett Packard printers are always a great value.
customer_reviews.author: keyring

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy 100
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with little knowledge. After reviewing the specifications, I decided to purchased it. So far it has been a great purchase and ease of use/installation.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a week then downloaded new software update and ever since the screen is stuck on installing update , happening to everyone if you read the forums
customer_reviews.author: Dna351

customer_reviews.title: Printer unable to copy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product for 10 weeks. I just tried the copy function and it does not work. It produces a black copy. User forums show this to be a widespread problem.
customer_reviews.author: JerryW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful printer. Does everything except fax. Touch screen. All kinds of extras such as coloring pages, coupons, maps and more.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: poor product
customer_reviews.text: Product failed in 2 weeks. Because of HP poor support, I am without a printer for 10 days. HP finally agreed to replace the unit with a used printer. After buying HP for 20 years, no more HP. I will also shop at a store so I can swap the unit for a new one. Very unhappy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Good little printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer for home use and I use it wirelessly, and it is very good. Quiet, too! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: B. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Great product for apple users
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for iPhone and I pad users. It handles all my printing needs while being compact and good looking.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Hardware Failure
customer_reviews.text: Hardware failed days out of warranty. This was a limited use device. HP's solution was to purchase new printer. Disposable printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Hp printer
customer_reviews.text: Works great I love it now all my devices print to one printer. Very easy to set up. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dbfreud

customer_reviews.title: Envy 100 e-All-in-One
customer_reviews.text: Veery happy so far. Too bad it does not have a paper feeder when doing multiple page scans. I like the design. It fits nicely without hampering the operation.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good parter for apple.
customer_reviews.text: It's really convienience to print stuff with apple product. Envy 100 is really good one as a printer at home.
customer_reviews.author: Davids

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Effortless setup. We are all printing from our iPhones, iPads, and computers. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Manford

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. The only problem is there are serveral different designs, but no way to choose the one you want. In the picture the top is black with brown squares, the one I received has a mirrored top with black circles. I couldnt figure out how to order the brown and black one, so i just kept the one I have.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever ordered
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great, upgraded from a Kodak that gave me nothing but trouble Now from the time I turned on this hp I fell in love!! So much going on! Can't wait to play
customer_reviews.author: Minpin

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. No wires, no muss, no fuss. It was so easy! It was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tipper

customer_reviews.title: HP ENVY
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an inexpensive printer and a reliable printer for documents and photos this is the one. Have used it for four weeks and it is the sweetest hp I have had to date and this is number 4 including two at the office. Great item and great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This printer was very easy to set up and has good print quality but 30 days after I purchased the printer it got stuck in some type of update loop. HP support is worthless, it took three seperate calls to get the problem resolved. Now I am going to get a reburbished printer. Do not buy this $200 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: TDH

customer_reviews.title: Not easy AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled! We are not new to setting printers up, but this HP Envy 10 D410 is not easy to set up. We had all kinds of trouble getting our iPad to recognize it and other issues. A real pain. It is beautiful and it works on the PC's, but it was designed for iPads and because of router and other problems it just didn't go well.
customer_reviews.author: Cinda

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless performance
customer_reviews.text: If you were waiting for that wireless printer to use with computers and especially the iPad, don't hesitate to get this great HP product!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Scala

customer_reviews.title: Nice little printer/scanner
customer_reviews.text: Printer and scanner work fine. Design is attractive. Firmware problems have been solved This printer once had serious firmware problems which have been fixed. No complaints now.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: As promised
customer_reviews.text: The printer got to me in just a few days, was in perfect condition and I love it. thank you
customer_reviews.author: L. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: It is a long story about what made me write this review. I can fill a couple of pages with the story of what went wrong and how the HP support kept me on the phone for hours. Problem was solved and the printer worked for just about 2 hours before it stopped again and I just decided that I would not use it anymore. This printer is nothing but headache. DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER.
customer_reviews.author: Shahram Vaziri

customer_reviews.title: Great printer...if it would only work!
customer_reviews.text: Great design and generally I've been happy with all of my previous HP purchases. However this time the equipment was dead on arrival. Touch screen wouldn't work at all and the power light just flashed continuously. Ended up getting HP to send me out a replacement which worked brilliantly first time. So a bit of a mixed review...love the printer but very disappointed with the fact that the first one didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shaw

customer_reviews.title: HP ENVY 100 D410--ALL IN ONE
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRINTER IS QUIET AND LOOKS GOOD.IT WORKS WELL AND NEEDS ONLY 2 INK CARTRIDGES, UNLIKE SOME OF THE NEWER ONES THAT USE 4 WHICH CONSTANTLY NEED REPLACING.
customer_reviews.author: herbert cohen

product_meta.title: HP Envy 100 e-All-in-One D410a Printer (CN517A#B1H)
product_meta.description:
Enjoy wireless, Web-connected printing with our sleek-looking and compact Envy 100 e-All-in-One D410a. Its high-resolution touchscreen will redefine the way you print, copy, and scan at home. And this is the world's first PVC-free printer. Get impressive photos and projects from the web using snapfish. Access and print web content without a PC using customizable print apps.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


WHY BUY?
 * High-resolution color touchscreen makes it easy to print, copy and scan
   
   
 * Quickly print from the web without a PC1
   
   
 * Send print jobs from any mobile device with e-mail capability using HP ePrint2
   
   
 * Use AirPrint™ to print from iPad®, iPhone® or iPod touch®3

Enlarge
SPECIAL OFFER 



FUNCTIONS
Enlarge 


WEB CONNECTED
Access and print from the Web using the color display and apps



HP ePRINT
If you can e-mail it, you can print it using HP ePrint2



AIRPRINT™
Simply print wirelessly from your iPad®, iPhone®, and iPod touch®.3




FEATURES
Enlarge Built-in Wireless Printing
Print from any room without using cables


Built-in Wired Networking
Share your printer with multiple people


Two-sided Printing
Save paper by printing on both sides automatically


Memory Card Slots
Print photos without using a PC


Color LCD Screen
Edit photos and/or manage your printer easily


4 x 6 Color Photo Printing
Print brilliant photos for albums or to enhance business documents


Auto Document Feeder
Fax, scan and copy multiple pages automatically


INCLUDED NOT INCLUDED

SPECIFICATIONS
Print Speed Up to 30 pages per minute black, up to 25 ppm color4; 4" x 6" photo as fast as 70 seconds


ScanResolution up to 1200-dpi optical; maximum scan size 8.5" x 11.69"


CopyMaximum number of copies, up to 50


Paper Handling 3" x 5" to 8.5" x 11.69"; up to 1,000 pages per month


Wireless Wireless 802.11n



REMEMBER ORIGINAL HP INK AND PAPER SAVE MONEY when you choose high-capacity cartridges over standard ones
RECOMMENDED HP INK5

60200 pages60XL600 pages


60165 pages60XL440 pagesRECOMMENDED HP PAPER

HP Advanced Photo Paper


HP Premium Plus Photo Paper


HP Bright White Inkjet Paper




MORE INFORMATION

Datasheet (PDF)

WHICH HP PRINTER IS RIGHT FOR YOU? 
Compare the good, better and best side-by-side 

See Comparison Chart



 1. Requires a wireless access point and an Internet connection to the printer. Services may require registration. Apps availability varies by country and language. For details, http://www.hp.com/go/ePrinterCenter.
 2. Requires an internet connection to the printer. Feature works with any internet- and email-capable device. Print times may vary. For a list of supported documents and image types, see www.hp.com/go/ePrintCenter.
 3. Supports iOS 4.2 devices (iPad, iPhone 4, iPhone 3GS, and 3rd and 4th generation iPod touch) that support multitasking. Works with HP ePrint-enabled printers and All-in-Ones. AirPrint and iOS 4.2 devices require an 802.11 wireless network connection to the printer. Wireless performance is dependent upon physical environment and distance from the access point. AirPrint and the AirPrint logo are trademarks of Apple Inc. iPad, iPhone and iPod touch are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
 4. After first page; see www.hp.com/go/inkjetprinter for details.
    
 5. Average based on ISO/IEC 24711 or HP testing methodology and continuous printing. Actual yield varies considerably based on content of printed pages and other factors. Some ink from included cartridge is used to start up the printer. For details see www.hp.com/go/learnaboutsupplies.
feature_bullets: Now AirPrint compatible. Simply print from iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.
Whisper-quiet operation and a retractable paper tray that you can tuck out of sight make the HP ENVY100 the perfect all-in-one for any room in the house.
This all-in-one has print speeds of up to 30 pages per minute black and 25 ppm color and wireless networking so you can print from any room in the house
Two-sided printing and high-capacity cartridges help cut down on printing costs, and this Energy Star-qualified inkjet printer helps you conserve energy
The HP ENVY100 lets you print Snapfish photos, coupons, movie tickets and other great Web content without a PC using print apps and the high-resolution color touchscreen
